channel.title: WWE on bumpXfeed
channel.description: Recent content in WWE on bumpXfeed

item.title: FAQ: What is the Match Quality Index (MQI) and how does it work?
item.description: A FAQ page that explains what the Match Quality Index (MQI) is and how it works, and how it can help you decide which matches to watch and which ones to skip from WWE, AEW, Impact, ROH, and other pro wrestling events.

item.title: WWE Crown Jewel 2023: The Best and Worst Matches to Watch
item.description: WWE Crown Jewel 2023 was a spectacular event that featured some of the best matches of the year. However, not all matches were created equal, and some of them were not worth your time. In this blog post, we will use a metric called the Match Quality Index (MQI) to rank the matches from best to worst, and give you our recommendations on which ones to watch and which ones to skip.

item.title: Superstars Background Breakdown: WWE Superstars who competed at Backlash 2023 Part 1
item.description: Discover the college sports backgrounds of WWE Backlash 2023 superstars! From Bianca Belair's track and field dominance to Brock Lesnar's collegiate wrestling championships, these athletes' college experiences shaped their journey to WWE. Part 1 of the Superstars Background Breakdown explores their impressive athletic achievements and showcases the diverse paths that led them to the grand stage of professional wrestling.

item.title: 2015 WWE Performance Center Trainees; Where Are They Now?
item.description: A bumpxfeed exclusive: We'll take a look at the 2015 WWE Performance Center trainees' professional wrestling careers from training to where they are now.

item.title: Pro Wrestling Training to Main Roster: Austin Theory from the WWE
item.description: Austin Theory defeated his childhood hero, WWE legend John Cena, by pinfall at Wrestlemania 39 in Los Angeles, California. While some may argue that his success has been quick, he's actually been wrestling matches since 2016. The 25 year old has 7 years of experience in the wrestling business, not including his training.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide to Trying Out for WWE's Performance Center / Tips to Become a WWE Sports Entertainer
item.description: So you want to be a pro wrestler / sports entertainer for the biggest wrestling company in the world? They actually made it easy for you to join and train at the world famous PC, aka the WWE Performance Center, located in Orlando, Florida. WWE (World Wrestling Entertainment) is constantly looking for fresh talent and even created a website to make the process easier. Scroll down to learn more!
